questions.text: What does IoT stand for?
questions.explanation: IoT stands for Internet of Things, connecting physical devices to internet.

questions.text: Which component senses physical parameters?
questions.explanation: Sensors detect and measure physical parameters like temperature, light, motion.

questions.text: What is an actuator in IoT?
questions.explanation: Actuator performs physical actions based on control signals (e.g., motor, valve, switch).

questions.text: Which protocol is commonly used in IoT?
questions.explanation: MQTT (Message Queuing Telemetry Transport) is lightweight protocol for IoT device communication.

questions.text: What is a microcontroller?
questions.explanation: Microcontroller is small computer on single integrated circuit, used in IoT devices.

questions.text: Which wireless technology has short range?
questions.explanation: Bluetooth has short range (typically up to 10 meters) for personal area networks.

questions.text: What is edge computing in IoT?
questions.explanation: Edge computing processes data near source (device/edge) rather than sending to cloud.

questions.text: Which is a common IoT platform?
questions.explanation: AWS IoT is cloud platform for IoT devices and applications.

questions.text: What is RFID?
questions.explanation: RFID uses radio waves to identify and track tags attached to objects.

questions.text: Which protocol is for low-power IoT?
questions.explanation: LoRaWAN is LPWAN (Low Power Wide Area Network) protocol for IoT devices.

questions.text: What is smart home?
questions.explanation: Smart home uses IoT devices for home automation (lighting, security, appliances).

questions.text: Which component connects IoT to internet?
questions.explanation: Gateway connects IoT devices to cloud/internet, often translating protocols.

questions.text: What is data analytics in IoT?
questions.explanation: IoT data analytics extracts insights from data generated by IoT devices.

questions.text: Which is a wireless sensor network?
questions.explanation: WSN is network of spatially distributed sensors that communicate wirelessly.

questions.text: What is Zigbee?
questions.explanation: Zigbee is wireless mesh networking standard for low-power, low-data-rate applications.

questions.text: Which is an IoT security concern?
questions.explanation: IoT security concerns include device hacking, data breaches, and unauthorized access.

questions.text: What is predictive maintenance?
questions.explanation: Predictive maintenance uses IoT sensors to predict equipment failures before they occur.

questions.text: Which frequency band does Wi-Fi use?
questions.explanation: Wi-Fi commonly uses 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequency bands.

questions.text: What is cloud computing in IoT?
questions.explanation: Cloud computing in IoT processes and stores data on remote cloud servers.

questions.text: Which is an example of Industrial IoT?
questions.explanation: IIoT (Industrial IoT) includes smart factories, predictive maintenance, supply chain optimization.

questions.text: What is latency in IoT?
questions.explanation: Latency is time delay between data transmission and reception in IoT systems.

questions.text: Which protocol is for constrained devices?
questions.explanation: CoAP (Constrained Application Protocol) is designed for constrained IoT devices.

questions.text: What is digital twin?
questions.explanation: Digital twin is virtual replica of physical device/system for simulation and analysis.

questions.text: Which technology uses light for communication?
questions.explanation: Li-Fi uses visible light for wireless communication instead of radio waves.

questions.text: What is firmware in IoT?
questions.explanation: Firmware is software programmed into IoT device's read-only memory.

questions.text: Which is a wearable IoT device?
questions.explanation: Wearable IoT devices include smart watches, fitness trackers, health monitors.

questions.text: What is M2M communication?
questions.explanation: M2M communication enables devices to exchange information without human intervention.

questions.text: Which is a long-range IoT protocol?
questions.explanation: NB-IoT (Narrowband IoT) is cellular technology for long-range IoT communication.

questions.text: What is IoT platform?
questions.explanation: IoT platform connects hardware, handles data, and provides applications/services.

questions.text: Which is a benefit of IoT?
questions.explanation: IoT benefits include improved efficiency, automation, and data-driven insights.
